intro: Lithocarpus cheliensis, commonly known as the Chinese ironwood, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts. It is a large evergreen tree native to southern China, particularly in Yunnan and Guangxi provinces. The plant is characterized by its hard, dense wood and leathery, elliptical leaves that remain on the tree for several years. Its fruit is a坚果 (nut) enclosed in a woody husk, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. This species is valued for its durable timber and is also of interest in ecological studies due to its role in forest ecosystems.
